title: Council of the European Union
summary: The Council of the European Union, often referred to in the treaties and other official documents simply as the Council,[lower-alpha 1] and informally known as the Council of Ministers, is the third of the seven Institutions of the European Union (EU) as listed in the Treaty on European Union.[1] It is one of three legislative bodies and together with the European Parliament serves to amend and approve the proposals of the European Commission, which holds legislative initiative.[2][3][4]
